climbs.name: Where the Fughowi
climbs.fa: John Mchugh, becky ficker, John Ficker 2/87

content.description: Climb shallow V chimney to hand crack. Climb face to top left side of gully
content.protection: small to large nuts, cams   Walk off South or two rope Rap.
content.location: Start is left of BI on the same face as Made in the Shade.

climbs.name: Moguls
climbs.fa: Larry Braten, Glen Dickensen, John Ficker 3/87

content.description: short broken crack to small roof to a face
content.location: Mid-wall right of the spalled out area of Bitches' Itch

climbs.name: Duckin' For Jesus
climbs.fa: J. Ficker, B. ficker, John Mchugh 2/87

content.description:
Dihedral left of the shallow V chimney of Where The Fughowi. Direct start is beyond a 5.6 any day.   Starting left and traversing over to shallow angling crack is dicey on lead but doable. 

  Per Phoenix Rock II:   5.7 variation: climb chimney above...(not sure where that is)go out on face before dihedral   5.8 variation: Climb face between Made in the Shade and Duckin' start
content.protection: 2 bolts, medium to small nuts, tricams, #4 BD   double rope rap or two raps. 2nd rap from Palo Verde at the top of Writer's block.
content.location: Left Dihedral of Made in the Shade face and the Where The Fughowi chimney.

content.description: Take discontinuous seam to horizontal crack, then continue up the face.
Just right of a large gully.
content.protection: 4 bolts large belay blocks are 8' right of the top of the arete
content.location: Climb the rounded arete. First bolt is 3' left of the arete.

content.description: Climb the finger crack to the roof. Continue of the right side of the roof and join Where the Fughowi at the upper hand crack.
content.location: Walk off South, or two rope rappel

content.description: This is the largest wall on the Northeast side of Little Granite Mountain, and readily visible from 136th St. The name comes from the scoops in it's face that resemble ski moguls. Full East exposure, and shaded after noon. This face gets little traffic.    The rock is granite with less flaking than the South crags.
